stories.title: Software From Scratch – S1E1 – Simple Scroller (when likes 1k I will make S1E2)
Signal app downloads spike as US protesters seek message encryption (2020)

stories.text:
I've created programming language based on Ruby that simplifies creating Terminal text-based games and applications in the browser. I've released first 1.0 beta version, but I'm still adding features and fixing bugs. I yet need to add more documentation and improve Gaiman playground.

The repo for the language can be found on GitHub: https://github.com/jcubic/gaiman the only documentation so far is the Wiki with Reference manual https://github.com/jcubic/gaiman/wiki/Reference-Manual and examples directory: https://github.com/jcubic/gaiman/tree/master/examples

And playground can be found at https://gaiman.js.org/ There is proper tutorial on my TODO list. I've created a game for it (guess the number) that is only 31 lines of code, I've added it to git: https://github.com/jcubic/gaiman/blob/master/examples/guess_the_number.gs

You can copy paste the code into playground and play with it.

On my road map there is also node.js version, so you will be able to run your apps in the terminal.
